snippet: Islamabad, which has been disrupted by vast traffic jams, barricaded streets and teeming political rallies, is slowly beginning to inch back to its usual routines.
abstract: Islamabad Journal; Islamabad, Pakistan, which has been disrupted by vast traffic jams, barricaded streets and teeming political rallies, is slowly beginning to inch back to its usual routine; however, public schools have yet to reopen and many businesses disrupted by the protests are finding it hard to get back on their feet.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and ZIA ur-REHMAN

lead_paragraph: Islamabad, which has been disrupted by vast traffic jams, barricaded streets and teeming political rallies, is slowly beginning to inch back to its usual routines.

headline.main: Beleaguered Pakistani Capital Inches Back to Normal
headline.print_headline: Beleaguered Pakistani Capital Inches Back to Normal
